1.4 Summary Description of the Project

Soubré Hydro Power Plant (hereafter referred to as “Soubré HPP”) is a greenfield project located about 5 km from Soubré village on the river Sassandra, San Pedro Province, Bas Sassandra region, Céte d'Ivoire. The geographical coordinates of the project extension limits are 5°48'33" W, 6°39'28" S (Northernmost point of the dam) and 5°46'56" W, 6°36'55" S (Easternmost point) which has been verified from the Location finder /08/.

The project activity is composed of a run-of-river hydropower plant with a capacity of 270 MW anda micro-hydro power plant of 5.35 MW generating capacity with a total estimated average gross electricity generation of 1,170 GWh per year, fed by a 17.3 km? reservoir. The plant is connected via three 225 kV transmission lines to the national grid: the transmission line Soubré-Buyo, Soubré-San Pedro and Soubré-Taabo. The technical specification of the turbines/alternators and the installed capacity of the project activity has been verified during the remote interview/physical site visit and also from the photos of the Turbines/alternators /09/.

The purpose of this project activity is to generate clean form of electricity and the net electricity generated from this project is supplied to the national grid via the transmission lines and PPA is signed between PP and the utility company /12/.
